Media Query Visualizer

  • Width

    The min. and max. width queries can be used on their own, or together to create a media query range.

  • Height

    The min. and max. height queries can be used on their own, or together to create a media query range.

  • Orientation

    The orientation accepts one of two values: portrait; or landscape.

  • Aspect Ratio

    Browsers support three different aspect-ratio media queries: aspect-ratio; min-aspect-ratio; and max-aspect ratio.

  • Resolution

    The resolution feature allows developers to serve alternate styles depending on the pixel density of a given screen.

    There are three different resolution media features: resolution; min-resolution; and max-resolution.

    The resolution media feature expects a value with a unit, where the unit is one of: dppx (dots per pixel); dpi (dots per inch); dpcm (dots per centimetre).

  • Color

    The color and monochrome media features can used to apply styles based on whether a given monitor supports/doesn't support colour.

    Neither of these features accept a value.
